title: Understanding the vertex form
text: Do you remember what the vertex form of a quadratic function looks like? It's $$f(x)={a\left(x-h\right)}^2+k$$, where (h,k) is the vertex.

title: Identify a, $$b$$, and c
text: In the quadratic function $$f(x)=2x^2-6x+7$$, identify the coefficients a, $$b$$, and c. They are crucial in rewriting the function into vertex form.

title: Calculate the x-coordinate of the vertex
text: Use the formula $$h=\frac{-b}{2a}$$ to find the x-coordinate of the vertex. What do you get when you substitute the values from $$f(x)=2x^2-6x+7$$?

title: Find the y-coordinate
text: Substitute $$x=\frac{3}{2}$$ into $$2x^2-6x+7$$ and simplify to find the y-coordinate of the vertex.

title: Rewrite the equation in vertex form
text: Now that you have (h,k) as the vertex, rewrite f(x) into the form $${a\left(x-h\right)}^2+k$$.
